intro: Cyrtandra micrantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant is herbaceous, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Cyrtandra micrantha plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems and is considered a species of conservation concern.
